sofya.ed.semantic
Interface InstrumentorObserver

All Known Implementing Classes:
ProbeTracker
public interface InstrumentorObserver

An instrumentor observer receives notifications from the SemanticInstrumentor indicating the transformations made to instrumented classes.

Version:
01/18/2007
Author:
Alex Kinneer

Method Detail

begin

void begin()
Notification that the instrumentor has started.

classBegin

void classBegin(java.lang.String className)
Notification that the instrumentor has begun instrumenting a new class.

Note: This method is called when the instrumentor is not in adaptive instrumentation mode (it believes it is instrumenting classes that were not previously instrumented). If the instrumentor is in adaptive instrumentation mode, it will issue the classBegin(ClassLog) notification.

Parameters:
className - Name of the class being instrumented.

classBegin

void classBegin(sofya.ed.semantic.ClassLog classLog)
Notification that the instrumentor has begun instrumenting a new class and that class was previously instrumented.

Note: This method is called when the instrumentor is in adaptive instrumentation mode. If the instrumentor is not in adaptive instrumentation mode, it will issue the classBegin(String) notification.

Parameters:
classLog - Instrumentation log for the class to be reinstrumented, which records the instrumentation previously applied to the class.

methodBegin

void methodBegin(org.apache.bcel.generic.MethodGen method,
                 org.apache.bcel.generic.InstructionList il)
Notification that the instrumentor has begun instrumenting a new method.

Parameters:
method - The BCEL object used for modifying the method.
il - Instruction list containing the bytecode for the method.

newProbe

int newProbe(byte eventCode,
             java.util.Set<java.lang.String> liveKeys)
Requests an identifier for a new probe to be inserted by the instrumentor. This identifier will be used to correlate subsequent notifications.

Parameters:
eventCode - Constant code indicating the type of event that required insertion of the probe, as defined in SemanticConstants.
liveKeys - Set of keys identifying the event specifications that actively require the presence of the probe.
Returns:
An integer to be used to correlate the changes made to the bytecode to insert a new probe.

probeInserted

void probeInserted(int id,
                   byte eventCode,
                   org.apache.bcel.generic.InstructionList il,
                   org.apache.bcel.generic.InstructionHandle ih,
                   boolean precedes)
Notification that bytecode was inserted to create a probe, or some part of a logical probe (a probe that requires more than one distinct bytecode modification to deliver a single event).

Parameters:
id - Identifier associated with the probe, as obtained from a prior call to newProbe(byte,Set).
eventCode - Constant code indicating the type of event that required insertion of the probe, as defined in SemanticConstants.
il - Bytecode instructions that were inserted by the instrumentor.
ih - Handle to the instruction in the original bytecode at which the insertion was performed.
precedes - If true, the probe instructions were inserted before ih in the instruction list, otherwise they were inserted after ih.

probeInserted

void probeInserted(int id,
                   byte eventCode,
                   org.apache.bcel.generic.InstructionHandle inserted,
                   org.apache.bcel.generic.InstructionHandle ih,
                   boolean precedes)
Notification that a bytecode instruction was inserted to create a probe, or some part of a logical probe (a probe that requires more than one distinct bytecode modification to deliver a single event).

Parameters:
id - Identifier associated with the probe, as obtained from a prior call to newProbe(byte,Set).
eventCode - Constant code indicating the type of event that required insertion of the probe, as defined in SemanticConstants.
inserted - Handle to the bytecode instruction that was inserted.
ih - Handle to the instruction in the original bytecode at which the insertion was performed.
precedes - If true, the new instruction was inserted before ih in the instruction list, otherwise it was inserted after ih.

probeRemoved

void probeRemoved(int id,
                  byte eventCode)
Notification that a logical probe was removed.

A logical probe constitutes the entirety of the bytecode changes required to raise a single event through the SemanticEventDispatcher. Due to complexity and performance considerations, individual notifications are not issued for the removal of each constituent bytecode modification (as is done during insertion).

Parameters:
id - Identifier associated with the probe, as obtained from a call to newProbe(byte,Set) at the time of instrumentation.
eventCode - Constant code indicating the type of event that depended on the existence of the probe, as defined in SemanticConstants.

exceptionHandlerAdded

void exceptionHandlerAdded(int id,
                           org.apache.bcel.generic.CodeExceptionGen handler,
                           boolean removable)
Notification that an exception handler was added to the exception handler table for the method.

Parameters:
id - Identifier associated with the probe, as obtained from a prior call to newProbe(byte,Set).
handler - The BCEL object representing the added exception handler.
removable - Flag indicating whether the added exception handler is eligible for removal during adaptive reinstrumentation. Certain exception handlers are added to implement transformations that support the raising of multiple other events, and thus should not be subsequently removed.

methodEnd

void methodEnd(org.apache.bcel.generic.MethodGen method,
               org.apache.bcel.generic.InstructionList il,
               gnu.trove.TIntObjectHashMap offsets)
Notification that the instrumentor has finished instrumenting a method.

Parameters:
method - The BCEL object used for modifying the method.
il - Instruction list containing the (now instrumented) bytecode for the method.
offsets - A mapping from pre-instrumented bytecode offsets to the BCEL InstructionHandle objects referencing the instructions at those offsets. This may facilitate working around an undesirable and poorly documented behavior of BCEL (see also SUtility.getRealPosition(org.apache.bcel.generic.InstructionHandle)).

callInterceptorAdded

void callInterceptorAdded(int id,
                          byte eventCode,
                          org.apache.bcel.generic.InstructionHandle call,
                          short origOpcode,
                          MethodSignature interceptor,
                          MethodSignature target)
Notification that a call interceptor method was added to the class.

A call interceptor method (also known as a trampoline) is a synthetic method inserted by the instrumentor by request, to provide access to method arguments at the site of calls to the target method.

Parameters:
id - Identifier associated with the probe, as obtained from a prior call to newProbe(byte,Set).
eventCode - Constant code indicating the type of event that required insertion of the probe, as defined in SemanticConstants.
call - Handle to the invoke instruction that is being replaced with an invocation of the interceptor method (the interceptor method will call the original target method).
origOpcode - Java bytecode opcode of the original invoke instruction that is being replaced.
interceptor - Signature of the added interceptor method.
target - Signature of the target method (the method being intercepted).

fieldInterceptorAdded

void fieldInterceptorAdded(int id,
                           byte eventCode,
                           org.apache.bcel.generic.InstructionHandle field_ih,
                           org.apache.bcel.generic.ConstantPoolGen cpg)
Notification that a call to a field interceptor was inserted in the class (see also, fieldInterceptorMethodAdded(MethodSignature)).

Parameters:
id - Identifier associated with the probe, as obtained from a prior call to newProbe(byte,Set).
eventCode - Constant code indicating the type of event that required insertion of the probe, as defined in SemanticConstants.
field_ih - Handle to the field instruction that is being replaced with an invocation of the interceptor method (the interceptor method will execute the original field instruction).
cpg - BCEL constant pool gen object for the class currently being instrumented.

fieldInterceptorMethodAdded

void fieldInterceptorMethodAdded(MethodSignature interceptor)
Notification that a field interceptor method was added to the class.

A field interceptor method (also known as a trampoline) is a synthetic method inserted by the instrumentor by request, to provide access to information about the current value (and new value, in the case of write events) of a field when capturing field events using breakpoints.

Parameters:
interceptor - Signature of the added interceptor method.

staticInitializerAdded

void staticInitializerAdded()
Notification that a static initializer was added to the class.

A synthetic static initializer is added to classes that do not already declare one. This is necessary to guarantee delivery of certain events.

exitProbeAdded

void exitProbeAdded(int id)
Notification that bytecode transformations were applied to provide for the raising of the method exit event.

The ID passed to this method should be recorded and passed back to the instrumentor during reinstrumentation, to prevent the instrumentor from attempting to apply the exit probe transformations again. This provides a convenient short-circuit in the instrumentor logic, avoiding what would otherwise be very complex bookkeeping to identify all the transformations required to raise this event (exit probes must be inserted in numerous places).

Parameters:
id - Identifier associated with the logical exit probe, as obtained from a prior call to newProbe(byte,Set).

classEnd

void classEnd(java.lang.String className)
Notification that the instrumentor has finished instrumenting a class.

Parameters:
className - Name of the class that was instrumented.

end

void end()
Notification that the instrumentor has completed its work.
